adjective.description: Suburban, specifically with reference to the immoral or licentious practices of the suburbs, especially of London; (now) of or relating to suburbia.

noun.description: A person who resides in a suburb. Now also: a resident of suburbia.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in Philemon Holland (1552–1637), translator. From classical Latin suburbium suburb + -an. In later use probably also partly from suburbia + -an.
